ĞÑ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¶Ğ´Ğ°Ğ» Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ° Ğ² Ğ¡Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ£Ñ€Ğ° ! 
ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµÑ‚ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑŒ 1 Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ»ĞµÑ† Ğ²Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ñ…, Ñ Ğ·Ğ°ÑÑƒĞ½Ñƒ ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ ÑĞµĞ±Ğµ Ğ² Ğ¶Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñƒ!!!
wow what a fun and new game this is i sure hope the developers care a lot about this game

So after 4 years and the things they have to show are:
- Few new gamemodes, heroes, and maps that are more of a seasonal update 
- A cancelled PVE mode ie one of the main reasons they used to justify the sequel
- Locking heroes behind a paywall, turning the game into P2W
- A microtransaction system that makes people miss lootboxes
- Overpriced contents that may not work properly if bought on steam with zero refund

The only good thing out of this mess is it being moved to steam since I get to read all the funny reviews about how good Blizzard at killing their own game.

When Activision bought out Blizzard, they have not stop sucking Bobby Kotick's dick ever since. The same company that tried to burn evidence, have a hotel room named after a famous star/predator, the works. I want nobody to give the suits shit for their stuff on the store. We used to gotten skins for free just by playing the damn game. Just do not try to go through hoops playing this game. Just stick w/either Team Fortress 2 or Paladins ( even though that game is glitchy as Hell & the connections are not the greatest) they will not try to rip you off though w/the slightest thing. So yeah, eat camel shit Activision & Blizzard. Bobby does not need another yacht for his prize possession. But if you still want to play this game, just play the multiplayer, because they did not fledge out the PvE worth shit like they did back on the first OverWatch.

ĞŸĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ² Ğ² ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»ĞºÑƒ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ», ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¸ PVE
This game has no reason to exist

I have a combined 840+ hours of playtime from (mostly) the first game and this new iteration while exclusively playing on PC. I got into the first game when it was season 12â€“15??, and I have a few thoughts I would like to share that I feel like a lot of other players with similar playtime as me would agree with. This is really long but I am passionate about this. Many others have said what I'm saying, but this is a more comprehensive write-up than those ones, sprinkled in with some of my thoughts at the end. TLDR; ONLY WORTH PLAYING IF YOU HAVE SUNK A LOT IN TIME INTO THE GAME AND ONLY HOPE TO SEE THE GAME SUCCEEDED MORE. 

While the gameplay of Overwatch (when it's good) is mostly solid, I simply cannot ignore the poor decisions that Blizzard continues to make that drive this game further into the ground. From the poor balancing decisions in each new and mid-season patch. To the unnecessary and overpriced seasonal battlepass that makes Overwatch veteran players miss the inclusion of lootboxes from the previous game, to make its user base want lootboxes added back is truly marvelous. There are also some other details (such as the end game cards) from the first game that did not carry over, which upset the community at large. Ignorance (or delay in fixing) of some bugs and glitches that are game-breaking. Blizzard's questionable politics and numerous controversies make supporting the game feel awkward (some of these made me boycott for a few months).

And most importantly, the 2 in the title of this game feels absolutely unnecessary because Blizzard continues to overpromise and always underdeliver. Just for context, for those that don't know, they stopped development on Overwatch (1) for a few years to focus on Overwatch 2. The second game was promoted to launch with PvE, and it was the new thing that Blizzard had been hyping for YEARS. It was a potential revival for a dying game that could bring back its player base. Over time, Overwatch 2 would see its launch date continuously pushed back adding more uncertainty to it's launch. When it did finally release, it did not arrive with PvE, and instead the community was told that PvE would come at a later date. OK, as long as they polished it, fans were okay since they wanted them to do it right. Unfortunately, with what was touted as the biggest update in Overwatch history since launch, fans are only getting a neutered version of what PvE was advertised as. On top of that, shortly after the news that PvE was going to be watered down, it was revealed that they had no plans to add what had been truly promoted previously and to abandon many of the ideas that they had showcased and demoed. I cannot say much about what PvE is actually like, as I refuse to buy the battlepass to access it, but it seems like it's not even worth the effort since it seems like Blizzard doesn't want to put as much effort into it as I do. As much as this was probably the execs and higher-ups idea and not the Overwatch team's idea to abandon many of the PvE ideas, it just showcases how shitty of a company they are. Also, yes, for those unaware, you have to buy the battle pass to get Overwatch's PvE content.

I really do have a love-hate relationship with this game. The core gameplay of Overwatch is truly unique and unlike any other team-based hero shooter (though I can't say I've tried many other hero shooters). Nothing really quite scratches the itch that Overwatch does. There is something truly satisfying and fun when the game functions properly, when the balance patch does not make any of its heroes feel too weak or too strong, and when the games feel like either team can win. And yes, those are a lot of barriers to jump over, but when those all align, the game is truly at its peak, and the game is very fun.

While the most important part of a game similar to Overwatch is its gameplay, which for the most part is well done (most of the time), it is still hard for me to recommend this game to new people who have never played the first game. Or even to those who have previously played this game. It feels very gatekeepery to say that, but I have asked a lot of people that have played since the first game and those that only got into the game this second time around, and most, if not all of them, agree that Overwatch (2) and Blizzard as a company stink. Only the ones sucked into this hellhole of a game are the ones that actually truly care and (somewhat) like this game and want it to succeed. I have not bought a a single micro-transaction since the beginning, and I still enjoy my time when I play, but sometimes it really does feel like I'm mindlessly playing the game just because I have become comfortable with it and it makes me forget about everyday worries.
Well, it [i]was[/i] a good game. I don't think becoming a laughing stock and a shell of what you used to be makes you worth playing.

ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.
